ygData.subject: Re: [gladiator] Re: Gladiator source
ygData.msgSnippet: Heya s, ... That s very generous of you Tom! ... Hehe, porting sounds like a big ball of fun :) ... I believe the only other project was an improved editor,

Heya's,

> > Just thought I'd jump in (I haven't been keeping track of the list
> > lately, but saw this go by).
> >
> > About the Gladiator clone/improvement/etc. on SourceForge ... if the
> > folks working on it (OpenGlad? :-) would like access to some or all of
> > the source code, just let me know.  All of the original FSGames team
> > is tied up 150% with Blizzard stuff, so we haven't had time to work on
> > Gladiator in quite a while ... so anything we can get you to help with
> > code, we'd be happy to supply.

That's very generous of you Tom!

> We havn't thought of a name, but OpenGlad is a good idea :-).
>
> We'd love to have access to the source, yes. Can it be provided under an
> open source license? Instead of making a clone from scratch, we could then
> port it to SDL (or some other cross-platform graphics library) and improve
> it from there.

Hehe, porting sounds like a big ball of fun :)

> The same goes for anyone else interested to help. I think we'll get alot
> more done if we're all working on one project instead of 2 or 3 different
> ones.

I believe the only other project was an improved editor, which complements
any new version anyway.
An actual clone was discussed, and I think DPH pretty much summed up the
decisions made on what we want to change in his post :)

I'd love to help out as well, however I've got this thing called uni
hounding me for the rest of the year and I'm also supposed to be leading
development on an EFS clone - a game somewhat larger than this one :/

I will keep an eye on what you get up to though, and if you need help
tracking down bugs just pop an e-mail my way - squishing bugs is one of the
best things I do ;)

- Deathifier
